title: AMD brings V-cache technology to enterprise market with EPYC 7003X “Milan-X” CPUs
content:
AMD is promising some big performance gains with its V-cache CPUs. The company is essentially adding an L3 cache (SRAM) chiplet in the form of a 3D die that’s stacked on top of the existing Zen 3 chiplet. This allows the V-cache CPUs to have triple the amount of L3 cache. The Ryzen 7 5800X3D

The post AMD brings V-cache technology to enterprise market with EPYC 7003X “Milan-X” CPUs appeared first on xda-developers.
description: AMD has announced the new EPYC Milan-X CPUs with 3D V-cache for the enterprise market. Here's everything you need to know about them.
